Definition: In this task, you're given a text. You need to output "Yes" if the text is about a person, otherwise output "No". Don't generate anything else apart from "Yes" or "No". The text is about a person if it is generally about a person. Mentions of people in the text don't necessarily mean the text is about a person.

Positive Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Positive Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, the answer is No.

Positive Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Positive Examples.explanation: Alison Bechdel is an American cartoonist. Clearly the text is about a person. The answer should be Yes.

Negative Examples.input: Text:  The third and current HMS Argyll is a Type 23 'Duke' Class frigate. She is currently the oldest serving Type 23 frigate in the Royal Navy. Like all of her class she is named for a British dukedom in this case that of Argyll.
Negative Examples.explanation: HMS Argyll is a frigate which a warship. Clearly the text is not about a person. Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Negative Examples.input: Text: Alison Bechdel (/ˈbɛkdəl/ BEK-dəl; born September 10 1960) is an American cartoonist. Originally best known for the long-running comic strip Dykes to Watch Out For she came to critical and commercial success in 2006 with her graphic memoir Fun Home.
Negative Examples.explanation: The output is neither "Yes" nor "No". Hence, it is an incorrect answer and a negative example.

Instances.input: Text:  Aaron James Hawk (born January 6 1984) is an American football linebacker for the Green Bay Packers of the National Football League (NFL). He played college football for Ohio State University where he earned All-American honors twice and was recognized as the top college linebacker. He was drafted by the Green Bay Packers fifth overall in the 2006 NFL Draft and was a member of the Packers' Super Bowl XLV championship team.
Text:  Choonda is a Malayalam language film. It was released in 2003.
Text:  Gil Dudson (born 16 June 1990 in Cardiff Wales) is a Welsh international rugby league player for Wigan in the Super League. He plays at prop.

Text:  Euphorbia baioensis is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. This spiny succulent plant is originally from Kenya. It is found in tropical deserts and flourishes in hot dry conditions.
Text:  Heliocheilus ranalaetensis is a moth in the Noctuidae family. It is endemic to South Australia.The larvae possibly feed on Triodia scariosa.

Text:  USS Bondia (AF-42) was an Adria-class stores ship acquired by the U.S. Navy for service in World War II. Her task was to carry stores refrigerated items and equipment to ships in the fleet and to remote stations and staging areas.Bondia was laid down on 18 September 1944 at Beaumont Texas by the Pennsylvania Shipyard under a Maritime Commission contract (MC hull 2204); launched on 9 November 1944; sponsored by Mrs.

Text:  Chen Chiung-her (Chinese: 陳江和; born January 15 1982 in Taiwan) is a Taiwanese baseball player who currently plays for Brother Elephants of Chinese Professional Baseball League. He currently plays as second baseman for the Elephants. He could play as three positions: second baseman shortstop or third baseman.
Text:  Niwa Odechowska [ˈniva ɔdɛˈxɔfska] is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Skaryszew within Radom County Masovian Voivodeship in east-central Poland.
